A B C D E F I L N O S T V

A

ApproximateEquality - Annotation Type in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.annotations
The ApproximateEquality annotation specifies equivalence as differing by less than its ApproximateEquality.tolerance() property.
ApproximateEqualityEquivalence - Class in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence
The EqualityEquivalence class defines equivalence on anynumeric type as close equality up to a given tolerance.
ApproximateEqualityEquivalence(double) - Constructor for class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.ApproximateEqualityEquivalence
Creates an ApproximateEqualityEquivalence with the given tolerance.
arrayEquivalence(Equivalence<? super T>, boolean) - Static method in class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.ArrayEquivalences
Adapts an equivalence on T into an equivalence on T[].
ArrayEquivalences - Class in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence
ArrayEquivalences allows to adapt an equivalence on a given type into an equivalence that acts upon arrays of that type.
asSpecifiedBy(Class<?>, Class<T>) - Static method in class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.matchers.Equivalences
Creates an Equivalence from the equivalence specification equivalenceSpecification.
asSpecifiedBy(Class<?>, Class<T>, Class<U>) - Static method in class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.matchers.Equivalences
Creates an Equivalence from the equivalence specification equivalenceSpecification.
asSpecifiedBy(Class<? extends EquivalenceSpecification<T>>) - Static method in class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.matchers.Equivalences
Creates an Equivalence from the equivalence specification equivalenceSpecification.

B

booleanArrayEquivalence(Equivalence<? super Boolean>, boolean) - Static method in class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.ArrayEquivalences
Adapts an equivalence on Boolean into an equivalence on boolean[].
ByEquivalence - Annotation Type in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.annotations
The ByEquivalence annotation specifies equivalence according to a pre-existing equivalence, allowing to reuse existing Matchers in an equivalence, albeit somewhat indirectly, as one must provide a concrete class implementing Equivalence with a no-argument constructor.
BySpecification - Annotation Type in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.annotations
The BySpecification annotation specifies equivalence as defined by a specification interface appropriate to the annotated property's type.
byteArrayEquivalence(Equivalence<? super Byte>, boolean) - Static method in class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.ArrayEquivalences
Adapts an equivalence on Byte into an equivalence on byte[].

C

charArrayEquivalence(Equivalence<? super Character>, boolean) - Static method in class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.ArrayEquivalences
Adapts an equivalence on Character into an equivalence on char[].

D

doubleArrayEquivalence(Equivalence<? super Double>, boolean) - Static method in class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.ArrayEquivalences
Adapts an equivalence on Double into an equivalence on double[].

E

Equality - Annotation Type in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.annotations
The Equality annotation specifies equivalence as the result of calling Object.equals(Object).
EqualityEquivalence<U> - Class in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence
The EqualityEquivalence class defines equivalence as equality by equals().
EqualityEquivalence() - Constructor for class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.EqualityEquivalence
 
Equivalence<T> - Interface in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence
This interface defines a relation over a type, computed and described with hamcrest matchers.
Equivalences - Class in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.matchers
This class has some factory methods to create Equivalence instances from equivalence specifications (i.e. classes annotated with EquivalenceSpecificationOn).
EquivalenceSpecification<T> - Interface in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.matchers
The EquivalenceSpecification interface is a marker interface used as a convenience in type parameter resolution.
EquivalenceSpecificationOn - Annotation Type in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.annotations
The EquivalenceSpecificationOn annotation declares that the annotated type (which must be a public interface) is an equivalence specification for the type returned by EquivalenceSpecificationOn.value() (henceforth called matched type).
equivalentTo(Number) - Method in class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.ApproximateEqualityEquivalence
Partial evaluation.
equivalentTo(U) - Method in class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.EqualityEquivalence
Partial evaluation.
equivalentTo(T) - Method in interface net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.Equivalence
Partially evaluates the relation.
equivalentTo(U) - Method in class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.IdentityEquivalence
Partial evaluation.
equivalentTo(Iterable<? extends T>) - Method in class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.IterableEquivalence
Partial evaluation.
equivalentTo(T) - Method in class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.LiftedEquivalence
Partial evaluation.

F

floatArrayEquivalence(Equivalence<? super Float>, boolean) - Static method in class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.ArrayEquivalences
Adapts an equivalence on Float into an equivalence on float[].

I

Identity - Annotation Type in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.annotations
The Identity annotation specifies equivalence as reference equality (==).
IdentityEquivalence<U> - Class in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence
The IdentityEquivalence class defines equivalence as equality by ==.
IdentityEquivalence() - Constructor for class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.IdentityEquivalence
 
intArrayEquivalence(Equivalence<? super Integer>, boolean) - Static method in class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.ArrayEquivalences
Adapts an equivalence on Integer into an equivalence on int[].
IterableEquivalence<T> - Class in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence
IterableEquivalence is an equivalence that acts upon Iterables of a type given an equivalence on the component type.
IterableEquivalence(Equivalence<? super T>, boolean) - Constructor for class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.IterableEquivalence
Creates an equivalence such that two Iterables are equivalent iff there exists a 1-to-1 mapping between their respective elements such that each pair of elements in the mapping are equivalent.

L

LiftedEquivalence<T,U> - Class in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence
LiftedEquivalence allows to extend an equivalence acting upon a type U to anoter type T using a function of T into U.
LiftedEquivalence(String, Equivalence<? super U>, Function<T, U>) - Constructor for class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.LiftedEquivalence
Creates an equivalence that considers t1 and t2 to be equivalent iff projection.apply( t1 ) and projection.apply( t2 ) are equivalent according to the argument equivalence.
longArrayEquivalence(Equivalence<? super Long>, boolean) - Static method in class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.ArrayEquivalences
Adapts an equivalence on Long into an equivalence on long[].

N

net.chwthewke.hamcrest.annotations - package net.chwthewke.hamcrest.annotations
This package contains the annotations used to declare equivalence specifications, which are interfaces annotated with EquivalenceSpecificationOn.
net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence - package net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence
This package contains the Equivalence interface central to the library, as well as some of the basic implementations used when creating equivalences from annotation-driven specification interfaces.
net.chwthewke.hamcrest.matchers - package net.chwthewke.hamcrest.matchers
This package exposes the implementation entry point Equivalences which has methods to create Equivalences from equivalence specifications.
NotPublic - Annotation Type in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.annotations
Used with an equivalence annotation, NotPublic declares that the annotated method should be used for equivalence even though it is not public, but merely visible, on the matched type.

O

OnArrayElements - Annotation Type in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.annotations
The OnArrayElements annotation modifies an accompanying equivalence annotation to specify an equivalence on arrays such that two arrays are equivalent when their elements can be paired in a way that puts equivalent elements in each pair.
OnIterableElements - Annotation Type in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.annotations
The OnIterableElements annotation modifies an accompanying equivalence annotation to specify an equivalence on Iterables such that two Iterables are equivalent when their elements can be paired in a way that puts equivalent elements in each pair.

S

shortArrayEquivalence(Equivalence<? super Short>, boolean) - Static method in class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.ArrayEquivalences
Adapts an equivalence on Short into an equivalence on short[].

T

Text - Annotation Type in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.annotations
The Text annotation specifies equivalence as equality on Strings up to a set of options.
TextEquivalence - Class in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence
The EqualityEquivalence class defines equivalence as equality on Strings starting with strict equality that can be relaxed by a number of options defined by the TextEquivalenceOption enum.
TextEquivalenceOption - Enum in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence
The options for TextEquivalence.
textEquivalenceWith(TextEquivalenceOption...) - Static method in class net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.TextEquivalence
Creates an Equivalence acting on Strings, that is by default like EqualityEquivalence, but can be relaxed by a number of options among the following: IGNORE_CASE makes the equivalence ignore case.

V

valueOf(String) - Static method in enum net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.TextEquivalenceOption
Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
values() - Static method in enum net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.TextEquivalenceOption
Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared.
